results.title: The Guns of Navarone
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Cecil F. Ford, Open Road Films and Columbia
results.brief_description: The suspense builds and the drama explodes in J. Lee Thompson’s finely crafted adaptation of Alistair MacLean’s best-selling novel. Gregory Peck, Anthony Quinn, David Niven, and Anthony Quayle are allied saboteurs, assigned an impossible mission - infiltrate an impregnable Nazi-held island and destroy two enormous long-range field guns that prevent the rescue of 2000 trapped British soldiers. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations, receiving the Oscar for Best Special Effects, this film is still regarded as one of the greatest action-adventure spectacles ever produced.

results.title: Slacker
results.brief_description: The “slacker” is post-baby boomer, post-Vietnam, post-Communism and post- punk. The “slacker” is looked upon by elder generations as lacking ambition and ignorant of responsibility. The “slacker” is the white-bread, educated and unemployable refuse of American society on a collision course with itself. This rivetting film rejects traditional Hollywood narrative conventions. Instead, seemingly random characters move in and out of the frame, and without ever losing its charm or its anarchic wit, this impressionistic film manages to convey much about the dysfunctional social arrangements governing contemporary America. However, this film does not patronise the “slacker generation”; instead it finds comedy and illumination in the obsessions of the young. A young, nerdy woman holds up a jar containing Madonna’s pap-smear samples and in that jar she finds grace. This externally low-budget experimental feature shows how courage, determination, imagination and sheer will can result in an innovative film, that for all its money and power, Hollywood cannot hope to emulate. “Slacker” is a very, very cool film.

results.title: Tie me up! Tie me down! = Atame!
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, El Deseo S. A. and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: A satiric and explicit look at the battle of the sexes, examining how a man and a woman relate to each other when they are literally ‘bound’ together. Ricky (Antonio Banderas), a 23 year old ex-psychiatric patient chooses for his wife, Marina (Victoria Abril), a B-grade and porn movie queen with whom he spent a night during one of his many escapes from the institution. But when Ricky visits Marina on the set of her new movie, she doesn’t even recognise him. He figures that his only option is to kidnap her, confident that she will fall in love with him. An audacious and startlingly strangely funny film from Almodovar. Spanish dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Song of the road = Pather panchali
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and Government of West Bengal
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel of the same name by Bibhutibhusan Banerji, this is the first part of Satyajit Ray’s renowned trilogy of films about Apu, the son of a would-be writer in a small Bengal village, who grows up in poverty before setting off with what remains of his family to seek a living in Benares. It shows Apu as a young boy experiencing his first taste of the delights and tragedies of life. The film is universally regarded as a great work of poetic cinema. Music provided by Ravi Shankar. Bengali dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Paisa
results.creator_credit: Roberto Rossellini, Foreign Film Productions and Organizzazione Film Internazionali
results.brief_description: Spoken in Italian dialogue with English subtitles. Covering the period from the Allied landings in Sicily in 1943 to the Liberation in 1945, Paisa is a film in six episodes. Each deals with a different aspect of the war in Italy; from the personal, (a drunken G.I. visits a prostitute and fails to recognise her as the young girl with whom he’d fallen in love only months earlier), to the field of battle itself, (brutal partisan warfare in Florence and the marshlands of the Po Delta). Following on from “Rome, Open City”, this was Rossellini’s second great neo-realist work and is one of the peak’s of film history. Stars Carmela Sazio, Robert Ban Loon, Dots M. Johnson, Maria Michi, Gar Moore, Harriet White, Renzo Avanzo, Bill Tubbs, Dale Edmonds.

results.title: 2 ou 3 choses que je sais d'elle = 2 or 3 things I know about her
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Parc Film, Le Films du Carosse, Argos Films and Anouchka Films
results.brief_description: Godard’s controversial reputation as one of the revolutionaries of film art is due to his use of film and video as mediums of philosophical investigation. This film is an essay which explores the relationships between the Western world and the developing world; the Parisian working class and the Gaulist government; US cultural imperialism and the Vietnam War; and the politics that occur when a male director explores the meaning of “woman”. If all this sounds obscure, difficult and pretentious, it is, but it is also exciting, challenging and powerful. At one point in the film a narrator imagines a synthesis of poetry and painting. “2 or 3 Things I know about her” achieves this synthesis in some of the most dazzling scenes ever filmed. What is this film? Literature or sociology? Documentary or essay? A poem or a lecture? Whatever it is, it is one of the most unique and audacious works in the history of cinema. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: An Actor's revenge
results.creator_credit: Kon Ichikawa, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Starring Kazuo Hasegawa, a Japanese matinee idol, this is the story of a kabuki actor who plans a long suffering revenge on the men who drove his parents to suicide. A melodrama, this film jumps from the swooning romanticism of the kabuki and its traditional music to stylised action and Hollywood jazz. At the centre of this, Hasegawa brushes aside his advancing years and delivers performances of enduring skill and charm.

results.title: Othello
results.brief_description: This magnificent film was shot on location throughout Europe and North Africa with a multinational cast and crew. Producer/director Orson Welles plays Othello and considered it to be one of his best films. Sadly, the film was believed to be lost for over thirty years. Finally, the original nitrate negative was tracked down and using today’s most innovative techniques, the film has been restored frame by frame to its original 91 minute director’s cut. Now this film is finally accessible to whole new generations of movie audiences.

results.title: The Arsenal stadium mystery
results.creator_credit: Thorold Dickinson, Josef Somlo and G&S Films
results.brief_description: Scotland Yard investigates when a caddish footballer dies by poisoning during a game between Arsenal and the Trojans. This fast-moving British thriller provides authentic footage of the pre-war Arsenal team training, playing and relaxing: from goalkeeper George Swindin to legendary winger Cliff ‘Boy’ Bastin. Genuine footage of a 1939 Arsenal match is intercut with re-staged close-up action. Stars Leslie Banks, Greta Gynt and the players and management of Arsenal Football Club 1939. From an original story by Leonard Reginald Gribble.

results.title: Blanche fury
results.creator_credit: Marc Allegret, Anthony Havelock-Allan and Cineguild
results.brief_description: A penniless ambitious governess becomes mistress of a stately home by marrying into the wealthy family of the headstrong Steward, (Stewart Granger), who aspires to run the estate. This is a beautifully mounted period (costume) drama which sits comfortably within the genre as a fine example of a family melodrama. A wronged illegitimate cousin, an illicit love affair and a double murder all contribute to the melodramatic story. Also stars Valerie Hobson.
